remarks: Induction on the upper integers that start at an integer ` M ` .  The first four hypotheses give us the substitution instances we need, and the last two are the basis and the induction step.  (Contributed by NM, 26-Jul-2005.)
statement:
uzind3.1 $e |- ( j = M -> ( ph <-> ps ) ) $.
uzind3.2 $e |- ( j = m -> ( ph <-> ch ) ) $.
uzind3.3 $e |- ( j = ( m + 1 ) -> ( ph <-> th ) ) $.
uzind3.4 $e |- ( j = N -> ( ph <-> ta ) ) $.
uzind3.5 $e |- ( M e. ZZ -> ps ) $.
uzind3.6 $e |- ( ( M e. ZZ /\ m e. { k e. ZZ | M <_ k } ) -> ( ch -> th ) ) $.
uzind3 $p |- ( ( M e. ZZ /\ N e. { k e. ZZ | M <_ k } ) -> ta ) $.
$d M j k m $.
$d N j k $.
$d ch j $.
$d j ps $.
$d j ta $.
$d j th $.
$d m ph $.
